Articles.Content: One of the biggest thing that bothers me in KSP is the lack of units. I have 5000 fuel left? 5000 what? Liters, gallons, cubic centimeters? Temperature is also confusing. It's impossible to tell if it's Kelvin, Celsius, or Fahrenheit. It would also be good to know what ElectricCharge is measured with. Just a simple suggestion, putting the unit of measure after a number would make things a lot easier.

Nutt, these threads always devolve into bickering over the perceived superiority of imperial or metric, so I'll have to close it.

I'm sure the devs have mentioned before that all measurements in KSP are metric, as they themselves use metric, not being American for the most part.

Fuel can be considered to be in litres, temperature readings are in Kelvin, and Electric charge can most closely be related to Amp-hours.
